headline: AMD shows off new higher performing AI chip at CES event
summary: Advanced Micro Devices CEO Lisa Su showed off a number of the company's AI chips on Monday at the CES trade show in Las ‚ÄãVegas, including its advanced MI455 AI processors, which are components in the data center server racks that ‚Äåthe company is selling to firms like ChatGPT maker OpenAI.  Su also unveiled the MI440X, a version of the MI400 series chip designed for ‚Äåon-premise use at businesses.  The so-called enterprise version is designed to fit into infrastructure that is not specifically designed for AI clusters.

content.summary: Advanced Micro Devices CEO Lisa Su showed off a number of the company's AI chips on Monday at the CES trade show in Las ‚ÄãVegas, including its advanced MI455 AI processors, which are components in the data center server racks that ‚Äåthe company is selling to firms like ChatGPT maker OpenAI.  Su also unveiled the MI440X, a version of the MI400 series chip designed for ‚Äåon-premise use at businesses.  The so-called enterprise version is designed to fit into infrastructure that is not specifically designed for AI clusters.

headline: AMD shows off new higher performing AI chip at CES tech show
summary:
STORY: Advanced Micro Devices CEO Lisa Su took the stage in Las Vegas on Monday. 

Speaking at the annual Consumer Electronics Show, she showcased the company's latest AI hardware and held up new chips for the crowd to see.

"MI455 is the most advanced chip we've ever built. It's pretty darn big. It has 320 billion transistors, 70% more than MI355."  

These chips power data‚Äëcenter racks that AMD sells to firms like OpenAI.

The president of the ChatGPT-maker, Greg Brockman, joined Su on stage. 

He said chip advances were vital to OpenAI's vast needs for computing power. 

Su also had big claims for another platform: 

"So let me tell you what it is. This is the smallest AI development system in the world, capable of running models with up to 200 billion parameters locally not connected to anything."  

AMD remains Nvidia's top rival in AI chips, but trails in market share.

A recent deal with OpenAI has been seen as a show of confidence in the company.

:: NVIDIA

But analysts say it's unlikely to dent the dominance of Nvidia, which showed off its own new chips the same day. 

Boss Jensen Huang says they deliver a five-times boost in power for AI uses.

content.title: AMD shows off new higher performing AI chip at CES tech show
content.summary:
STORY: Advanced Micro Devices CEO Lisa Su took the stage in Las Vegas on Monday. 

Speaking at the annual Consumer Electronics Show, she showcased the company's latest AI hardware and held up new chips for the crowd to see.

"MI455 is the most advanced chip we've ever built. It's pretty darn big. It has 320 billion transistors, 70% more than MI355."  

These chips power data‚Äëcenter racks that AMD sells to firms like OpenAI.

The president of the ChatGPT-maker, Greg Brockman, joined Su on stage. 

He said chip advances were vital to OpenAI's vast needs for computing power. 

Su also had big claims for another platform: 

"So let me tell you what it is. This is the smallest AI development system in the world, capable of running models with up to 200 billion parameters locally not connected to anything."  

AMD remains Nvidia's top rival in AI chips, but trails in market share.

A recent deal with OpenAI has been seen as a show of confidence in the company.

:: NVIDIA

But analysts say it's unlikely to dent the dominance of Nvidia, which showed off its own new chips the same day. 

Boss Jensen Huang says they deliver a five-times boost in power for AI uses.

headline: Nvidia's Rubin Chips on Track, CEO Huang Says
summary: Nvidia's highly anticipated Rubin data center processors are in production and customers will soon be able to try out the technology, according to Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang. Meanwhile, Advanced Micro Devices announced a new chip for corporate data center use and talked up the attributes of a future generation of products for that market. Bloomberg Intelligence's Masahiro Wakasugi breaks down the situation.

Bloomberg Intelligence's Masahiro Wakasugi breaks down the situation.

headline: Nvidia‚Äôs $4 Trillion Stock Rally Faces More Threats Than Ever
summary: Nvidia Corp. shares are down 9.1% since hitting a record on Oct. 29, well underperforming the S&P 500 Index, as investors grow concerned about the sustainability of artificial intelligence spending and the chip giant‚Äôs grip on the market.  The recent drop is notable considering that on the day the stock last closed at an all-time high, it was up more than 1,300% since the end of 2022 and Nvidia‚Äôs market capitalization was over $5 trillion compared with roughly $400 billion less than three years earlier.  Meanwhile, the dominant AI chipmaker is facing more competition than ever before from rivals like Advanced Micro Devices Inc., as well as its biggest clients, including Alphabet Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. And Wall Street is growing increasingly worried about Nvidia‚Äôs investments in many of its customers, which could be seen as artificially propping up demand.

content.title: Nvidia‚Äôs $4 Trillion Stock Rally Faces More Threats Than Ever
content.summary: Nvidia Corp. shares are down 9.1% since hitting a record on Oct. 29, well underperforming the S&P 500 Index, as investors grow concerned about the sustainability of artificial intelligence spending and the chip giant‚Äôs grip on the market.  The recent drop is notable considering that on the day the stock last closed at an all-time high, it was up more than 1,300% since the end of 2022 and Nvidia‚Äôs market capitalization was over $5 trillion compared with roughly $400 billion less than three years earlier.  Meanwhile, the dominant AI chipmaker is facing more competition than ever before from rivals like Advanced Micro Devices Inc., as well as its biggest clients, including Alphabet Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. And Wall Street is growing increasingly worried about Nvidia‚Äôs investments in many of its customers, which could be seen as artificially propping up demand.

headline: AI is growing so much, we'll need 'yottaflops' of compute: AMD CEO
summary: AMD (AMD) CEO Lisa Su delivered the first keynote speech of CES 2026 on Monday night. She showed off the company's new Helios AI rack and the latest Ryzen AI 400 Series and Ryzen AI Pro 400 Series chips. She also shed light on how fast AI is changing computing. Watch the video above to hear what she had to say. Click here to learn more about AMD's CES announcements.

Watch the video above to hear what she had to say.

headline: Nvidia Vera Rubin, Dow tops 49K, business optimism: 3 Things
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang unveiled a variety of new projects and innovations at his keynote speech at CES 2026 on Monday, including the chipmaker's Vera Rubin AI platform. US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are mixed in Tuesday's premarket trading after the Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) reached a new record high above 49,000 yesterday. A majority of small and medium business owners appear cautiously optimistic for 2026, according to a new study from Bank of America. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are mixed in Tuesday's premarket trading after the Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) reached a new record high above 49,000 yesterday.

A majority of small and medium business owners appear cautiously optimistic for 2026, according to a new study from Bank of America.

Designed for AI developers, start-ups, and higher education and research professionals, Supermicro's new portfolio of products brings the latest innovation and performance to the desktop, edge, and consumer markets.

content.title: Supermicro Brings Enterprise-Class AI Performance to the Client, Edge, and Consumer Markets
content.summary: Super Micro Computer, Inc. (SMCI), a Total IT Solution Provider for AI/ML, HPC, Cloud, Storage, and 5G/Edge, will showcase its latest high-performance Super AI Station in Las Vegas, Nevada. Designed for AI developers, start-ups, and higher education and research professionals, Supermicro's new portfolio of products brings the latest innovation and performance to the desktop, edge, and consumer markets.

headline: This AI-Powered Marketing-Tech Stock Is Up 11% on OpenAI Partnership
summary: As is the case with most stocks in OpenAI‚Äôs orbit,  Zeta Global Holdings  surged after the marketing-technology company unveiled a collaboration with the ChatGPT maker.  Zeta said it plans to use OpenAI‚Äôs models to power its artificial-intelligence agent, Athena.  The company, which bills itself as an ‚ÄúAI-powered marketing cloud,‚Äù aims to offer the agent to all customers by the end of the first quarter.

headline: Nvidia could reach a $6 trillion market cap, Dan Ives explains
summary: Major tech conference CES 2026 kicked off this week with presentations from Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) CEO Lisa Su, both companies revealing new AI projects and partnerships. Wedbush Securities managing director and global head of technology research Dan Ives ‚Äî alongside D.A. Davidson head of technology research Gil Luria and Yahoo Finance senior reporter Ines Ferr√© ‚Äî reacts to AMD's outlook on AI computing and how he sees Nvidia reaching a $6 trillion market cap. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

Major tech conference CES 2026 kicked off this week with presentations from Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) CEO Lisa Su, both companies revealing new AI projects and partnerships.

Wedbush Securities managing director and global head of technology research Dan Ives ‚Äî alongside D.A. Davidson head of technology research Gil Luria and Yahoo Finance senior reporter Ines Ferr√© ‚Äî reacts to AMD's outlook on AI computing and how he sees Nvidia reaching a $6 trillion market cap.

headline: AMD Shares Slide Even as CEO Points to Soaring Computing Demand
summary: At an event at the CES trade show Monday, Su announced a new chip for corporate data centers and touted the capabilities of its top-of-the-line MI455X processor.  AMD has emerged as the biggest contender to Nvidia Corp. in the market for AI accelerators, the chips that help develop and run artificial intelligence models.  During a Bloomberg Television interview Tuesday, Su said that more widespread use of artificial intelligence in 2026 will help everyone understand that ‚ÄúAI is not just hype.‚Äù

content.title: AMD Shares Slide Even as CEO Points to Soaring Computing Demand
content.summary: At an event at the CES trade show Monday, Su announced a new chip for corporate data centers and touted the capabilities of its top-of-the-line MI455X processor.  AMD has emerged as the biggest contender to Nvidia Corp. in the market for AI accelerators, the chips that help develop and run artificial intelligence models.  During a Bloomberg Television interview Tuesday, Su said that more widespread use of artificial intelligence in 2026 will help everyone understand that ‚ÄúAI is not just hype.‚Äù

headline: AMD to Report Fiscal Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Financial Results
summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., Jan. 06, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- AMD (NASDAQ: AMD) announced today that it will report fiscal fourth quarter and full year 2025 financial results on Tuesday, Feb. 3, 2026, after the market close. Management will conduct a conference call to discuss these results at 5:00 p.m. EST / 2:00 p.m. PST. Interested parties are invited to listen to the webcast of the conference call via the AMD Investor Relations website ir.amd.com. AMD also announced it will participate in the follo

content.title: AMD to Report Fiscal Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Financial Results
content.summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., Jan. 06, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- AMD (NASDAQ: AMD) announced today that it will report fiscal fourth quarter and full year 2025 financial results on Tuesday, Feb. 3, 2026, after the market close. Management will conduct a conference call to discuss these results at 5:00 p.m. EST / 2:00 p.m. PST. Interested parties are invited to listen to the webcast of the conference call via the AMD Investor Relations website ir.amd.com. AMD also announced it will participate in the follo
